snippet: Few in Ferguson, Mo., expect peace when, sometime in the next few weeks, a grand jury decides whether to indict the police officer who shot an unarmed black teenager in August.
abstract: Residents of Ferguson, Mo, anxiously await grand jury's decision whether to indict Officer Darren Wilson, who fatally shot unarmed black teenager Michael Brown in August, inciting months of protests and putting Ferguson at center of national debate over police and race; many believe Wilson will not face serious charges.

byline.original: By JULIE BOSMAN and MONICA DAVEY
byline.contributor: Julie Bosman reported from Ferguson, and Monica Davey from Chicago. Matt Apuzzo and Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Few in Ferguson, Mo., expect peace when, sometime in the next few weeks, a grand jury decides whether to indict the police officer who shot an unarmed black teenager in August.

headline.main: Ferguson Waits Uneasily for Grand Jury’s Decision
headline.print_headline: Ferguson Waits Uneasily for Grand Jury’s Decision
